card.flavor: Ratlings or Unicorn war-dogs would have been preferable to this disheveled man, but he would have to make do with him.

card.name: Aramasu's Legacy
card.text: Limited: Create an additional Attack Phase, during which battle resolution does not destroy defending armies or provinces and does not bow your Mantis Clan Magistrates or your attachments. After it ends, if you won any of its battles (even against no units at resolution), you may target a Personality or Holding, bow it, and negate its straightening until after your next Straighten Phase ends.

card.name: Monastery of New Thought
card.text:
Limited: Target your Tattooed Personality: Give him a +1F Fire token.
Battle: Destroy a Fire token on your performing Personality: Ranged 5 Attack.
card.flavor: "Their methods and actions are indecipherable as ever, yes, but I believe we have no choice. We must trust in the Togashi to be our eyes and hands throughout the Colonies." - Kitsuki Daisuke

card.name: The Castle of Order
card.text:
You do not lose Honor from Ninja cards you own.
When another player's Battle action would target your Ninja: He is a master of the art of Ninjutsu. Once per battle, you may choose your Ninja at the same location. If you did, the action targets it instead, if legal.
card.flavor: "Men speak of law and order as if they were one and the same. One cannot achieve the other." - Soshi Kodanshi

card.name: Interesting Plains
card.text:
Singular
Reaction: After a Personality enters play from this province: Refill the province face-up.
card.flavor: "It is called such because, allegedly, there is always something... interesting... happening there. The definition of interesting varies, of course." - Miya Kitori

card.name: Sinkhole
card.text: Battle: Destroy any player's Terrain or Region at the current battlefield and target a Personality: His path is blocked. Bow him or move him home.
card.flavor: "Not all dangers need be supernatural or military in nature, it seems. How dreadfully pedestrian." - Otomo Suikihime

card.name: Low Market
card.text:
Market
Open: Bow this card, choose your performing Personality and target an attachment in your hand: Attach it to him, paying 2 less Gold, to a minimum of 1.

(MRP)
card.flavor: Even in the new kingdom, there are places that the samurai choose not to acknowledge.

card.name: Library of Rebirth
card.text:
Reaction: Even if this card is bowed, when paying for a Spell attaching to an opposed Personality: Produce 4 Gold.
Battle: Choose your performing Shugenja: Straighten him. You may take an additional Battle action.

(MRP)
card.flavor: Within the Second City, the Phoenix delved into all manner of lore once overlooked.

card.name: Isawa Momoko
card.text:
Phoenix Clan • Fire • Shugenja
Battle/Open: After the next time this turn you announce an action on one of Momoko's Spells, ignore the action's bowing costs. You may take an additional action.

(MRP)
card.flavor: "There is an easier way to attain the goal you seek."

card.name: Basic Lesson
card.text:
Limited: Create a (bowed) Holding with the trait "Bow this card: Produce 3 Gold." Negate your Stronghold's straightening (this turn))
Open: Destroy your target Holding: Create a Samurai Personality with 3C/2PH and Force equal to the Holding's base Gold Cost.

(MRP)
card.flavor: A shugenja must learn to respect the elements. Students are often fond of pulling pranks on those who may take the lesson too seriously.

card.name: Renewal
card.text:
Unique
Open: If it is not the active player's first or second turn, discard a card and choose your performing discarded Personality: Bring him into play, paying all costs.
card.flavor: "With all the secrets we gain from this realm, anything may be possible." - Isawa Kojiro

card.name: Cultist Infiltrator
card.text:
You may attach this card to a Personality you do not control.
This card will not be transferred.
After each Straighten Phase: Give this Personality a -1C token.

(MRP)
card.flavor: "There are strange forces within this land, and we would be fools not to be watchful." - Komori

card.name: Resurrection
card.text:
Unique
Open: Discard a card and choose your performing dead Personality: Bring him into play, paying all costs.
card.flavor: "If the other clans find our methods so distasteful, then let them take our place on the deadly frontier. Let their lives buy prosperity for us, and then I will hear them." - Daigotsu Kanpeki

card.name: Only a Shadow
card.text:
Ninja
Limited: Choose your performing unbowed Personality with the base Ninja keyword: He infiltrates the enemy ranks. Permanently give him the trait, "After a Straighten Phase begins: Choose your bowed non-Ninja Personality. Negate his straightening this phase." Give control of him to another player.

(MRP)
card.flavor: "No one sees what is not there." - Goju Yurishi

card.name: Genjiro
card.text:
Ninja
Limited: Bow Genjiro and target a bowed Personality: You kidnap him and hold him for ransom. While Genjiro remains bowed, you may negate his straightening, the target's straightening is negated, and all players have the ability, "Open: Pay 6 Gold: Destroy a Genjiro."
card.flavor: "Shh. this will all be over in a moment."

card.name: Border Keep - inexp
card.text:
Winter • Inexperienced • Unique
Bow this card: Produce 2 Gold.
Limited: If it is your first turn: Put one or more cards in your provinces at the bottom of your deck, refilling the provinces face-up.
card.flavor:
"It is a gentle, peaceful place. One can find true serenity there. I would see it remain so." - Shiba Mitsushen

"You call it an inconsequential target. I call it an opportunity to demonstrate why one should never cross the Scorpion." - Yogo Haruto

card.name: Akodo Shihiro
card.text:
Lion Clan • Samurai • Soul of Akodo Ieshige
Before (each time) another player's action resolves during a battle at Shihiro's battlefield: Give Shihiro +1F (until the turn ends).
card.flavor:
"I crave war. If I must fight alongside the Scorpion to experience it, then so be it."

"When you believe that there is no limit to what an opponent is capable of, then it becomes true. Neither underestimate nor fear him, for both give him advantage." - Daidoji Kenshi

"This Haruto is a despicable, hideous man, but his skill at war cannot be denied."

card.name: Isawa Taiken
card.text:
Phoenix Clan • Fire • Shugenja • Duelist • Firestorm Legion • Soul of Isawa Kokuten
Battle: Bow Taiken: Ranged 4 Attack.
card.flavor:
"Every Phoenix hopes for peace. I simply understand that the path to peace may unfortunately be one strewn with ashes."

"I fear sensei Ochiai-sama would not have approved of my methods. I hope that in her retirement she is never burdened with the tale of my victories in the Scorpion lands. I wish her only contentment."

"For his crimes against the Scorpion, let him forever be known as the Murderer of Shutai. The other clans enjoy casting out pretentious labels, so let us see how they like it." - Bayushi Nitoshi

card.name: Isawa Nairuko
card.text:
Phoenix Clan • Earth • Shugenja • Soul of Isawa Mariko
Nairuko has +2F while she has a Spell.
card.flavor:
"Young? Perhaps I am. Power knows no age, and I shall see the Scorpion broken before me, as they were before my ancestors."

"For an acolyte, she possesses unique insights and tremendous skill. I think she will have a bright future, if she can but overcome her more earthly tendencies. Ironic, I know." - Isawa Norimichi, Elemental Master of Earth

The Scorpion forces surged forward to eliminate the battered Phoenix line, but a wall of earth sprang up to block their path. "Turn back and live," a woman's voice boomed, "or your corpses shall rest with the stones forever deep inside the earth."

card.name: Shiba Mitsushen
card.text:
Phoenix Clan • Samurai • Commander • Unique
Battle: Target your Personality: Move him to Mitsushen's battlefield. If he moved, straighten his unit.
card.flavor: "When my life is at an end, what shall be said of me? Let others say only that I honored my clan above all else."

card.name: Shiba Jikaro
card.text:
Phoenix Clan • Samurai • Stalwart • Yojimbo
(Stalwart cards negate their first bowing each turn by other players' cards.)
card.flavor:
"When I was a child, I dreamt of serving the Phoenix as a warrior on the field of battle. Never did I imagine what horrors war holds for those who wage it."

"I understand now, truly understand, the desire for peace that so many of my brothers exemplify. I was a fool to have ever doubted their wisdom."

"For all that I now wish for peace, however, I am unable to silence the hope that the Scorpion will see justice for their crimes."

card.name: Shiba Tsukimi - exp3.5
card.text:
Phoenix Clan • Clan Champion • Daimyo • Samurai • Duelist • Experienced 3.5 • Loyal • Unique • Shiba's Soul
Battle: Twice per turn, target a card in a unit: Straighten it. It may use its abilities a second time this turn.
card.flavor: "This is a disgrace, and I will bear it no longer. I will see Nitoshi answer for his crimes, each and every one of them."

card.name: Shosuro Chikata
card.text:
Scorpion Clan • Ninja • Soul of Bayushi Kasata
Battle: Even if Chikata is bowed, target a Scorpion Clan or Dragon Clan Personality: Bow or straighten him.
card.flavor:
"I follow your lead, Konishi. Together we will bring ruin to the house of Agasha."

Haruto's agents slipped into the city like shadows, laying the seeds for the ruin of the Agasha for days. While the Phoenix watched the Scorpion armies, the Scorpion's shadow was strangling them from within.

Konishi gave the signal, and Chikata felt joy surge in his heart. He emerged from the shadows like a dream, and his steel found the throat of a Phoenix sentry. As the man dropped lifeless to the ground, Chikata sighed happily. This was his life.

card.name: Bayushi Utoro
card.text:
Scorpion Clan • Samurai • Soul of Bayushi Motomu
Battle: Even if Utoro is bowed, discard a card and target a Personality: Straighten him.
card.flavor:
"There are those who question the honor of my lord. Such as they should pray they never cross my path."

"My will and my loyalty were tested in blood and fire, and I was not found wanting. I will bring glory to my ancestors for many years to come."

"Often I have wondered at my place in this world. I know now that I am a warrior, a weapon of the Scorpion, and I take comfort in that fact."

card.name: Bayushi Nitoshi - inexp
card.text:
Scorpion Clan • Clan Champion • Courtier • Samurai • Sociopath • Inexperienced • Loyal • Unique • Shoju's Soul
Battle/Limited: Look at the top card of your Fate deck. If it is an attachment, you may attach it to one of your Personalities at Nitoshi's location, paying all costs. If it is a Strategy, you may take an additional action to play it (if legal).
card.flavor: "Duels, court, war... all merely distractions."

card.name: Bayushi Kasumi
card.text:
Scorpion Clan • Samurai • Elite
(Elite cards contribute Force even if bowed.)
card.flavor:
"Her lust for the deaths of our enemies is cold and calculating, but she shows potential. If she survives this war, she may emerge with some use in the future. We shall see what fate has in store." - Yogo Haruto

"She is a monster, the likes of which can only be eclipsed by her dark master, Yogo Haruto. I will see her answer for his crimes or die in the attempt." - Isawa Nairuko

"I love nothing more than the feel of a dead Phoenix at the end of my blade. It fills me with a sense of pride, and I know my ancestors are smiling upon me."

card.name: Yogo Haruto
card.text:
Scorpion Clan • Air • Shugenja • Commander • Villain • Loyal • Unique
Battle: Target a Follower in your discard pile: Attach it to Haruto, paying 2 less Gold.
card.flavor: "He is delightfully devoid of anything resembling scruples or a conscience. It is amazing what a man can accomplish for his lord when he is without the burden of a soul." - Bayushi Nitoshi

card.name: Rank & File
card.flavor:
"The first true conflict since the Destroyer War ended, the War of the Twins began with the mysterious death of a Phoenix inquisitor and his attendants while visiting the Scorpion lands. The Scorpion would not permit Phoenix investigations." - The War of the Twins, Part I

"The conflict between the two clans began in court, with the Phoenix seeking satisfaction. The Imperial line would not intervene, and eventually the Phoenix petitioned for the right to avenge their honor on the field of battle. The Empress agreed." - The War of the Twins, Part II

"The Scorpion launched a pre-emptive incursion into the Phoenix lands, and the Phoenix were ill-prepared. The land was scarred by the intensity of the battles, and ultimately the war was resolved by the strength of will and speed of steel." - The War of the Twins, Part III

card.name: Communion with Earth
card.text:
Earth
This Shugenja has Stalwart. (Stalwart cards negate their first bowing each turn by other players' cards.)
Battle: Target another of your Shugenja, who must be Earth: Transfer this card to him.
card.flavor:
"The greatest joy that exists is to experience the soul of your fellow Phoenix through the eyes of the Earth." - The Journal of Isawa Emori, Volume I

"Through the earth, we are all radiant and beautiful, fleeting and impermanent. The perspective is unique." - The Journal of Isawa Emori, Volume II

"Yet at the center of each of our spirits, there is a kernal of eternity, like stone itself. This is the immortal soul." - The Journal of Isawa Emori, Volume III

card.name: Elite Training
card.text: Limited: Choose your performing Personality: He undergoes vigorous training. Permanently give him Elite. (Elite cards contribute Force even if bowed.)
card.flavor:
"Assemble your finest assassins, officers. I want to see this upstart general dead on the ground. I want to see his men weeping and tearing at their clothes. I want them broken." - Yogo Haruto

"Ready yourselves," Kasumi commanded. "This is the most important assignment you will ever receive. Those of you who survive will find yourselves well and truly elevated."

Jikaro's blade danced through the air, mere inches above Utoro's head. The Scorpion warrior rolled across the ground, lashing out at the Phoenix's legs, but his blade fell short. Each knew that they would face one another again.

card.name: The Sacred Temple of the Phoenix - inexp
card.text:
Temple • Inexperienced
When paying for a Spell or Shugenja, bow this card: Produce 5 Gold.
card.flavor: In the northeastern reaches of the Empire, the Phoenix delve into the screts of the universe with their wisdom, and some say with their arrogance as well.

card.name: Tsubo - exp
card.text:
Ronin • Samurai • Sober • Experienced Tsubo the Drunk • Unique
Battle: Even if Tsubo is bowed, target a Personality: Straighten him.
card.flavor: "The Phoenix saved me when I was lost, and they brought me back from the brink of the abyss. I will never crawl into a bottle again, and I will never forget the debt I owe to the Phoenix."

card.name: Bamboo Harvesters
card.text:
Forest • Unique
This card will not straighten before your second turn.
Bow this card: Produce 2 Gold.
card.flavor: "The forests in the Phoenix lands are sacred, and they often eschew even the use of bamboo in building. Just another example of their foolishness." - Bayushi Manami

card.name: Bushi Dojo
card.text: When paying for a Follower or an action that creates a Follower, bow this card: Produce 6 Gold.
card.flavor:
"Our clan is known for its shugenja, and rightfully so. Those of us who carry the sword should never find reason to give less than all of ourselves."

"The secret to any enemy's style can be found within their dojo. Find a means of gaining entry to observe, and victory will be yours." - Shosuro Konishi

"Guard the secrets of your own dojo as closely as you can. If your enemy must discover something, then set for him a false dojo, and control the lies that he takes away." - Shosuro Konishi

card.name: Diamond Mine
card.text:
Mine
Bow this card: Produce 5 Gold.
card.flavor:
"Small, easily concealable, and highly valuable. I find they have an almost infinite variety of uses." - Bayushi Manami

The concept of wealth and money are unclean things for an honorable samurai. To sully one's hands with money is dishonorable. Unfortunately, the reality of existence is such that money is not something one can simply ignore and survive.

"The Scorpion delve deep beneath the earth, seeking secret wealth hidden away in the recesses of the world. There is nothing they do, it seems, that they cannot wrap in a veneer of dishonor." - Isawa Nairuko

card.name: Geisha House
card.text:
Geisha House
Bow this card: Produce 2 Gold, or 3 Gold if you are a Scorpion Clan player.
card.flavor:
"There is no greater resource than information. With the proper secrets in your pocket, your enemy will give you all the gold you require." - Shosuro Konishi

"Welcome to the House of the Gentle Petals, magistrate-sama," the geisha said with a coy smile. "We are delighted to have such august company this evening. May I offer you rour special house blend? I promise you there is nothing quite like it."

"I do not know what they serve in that wretched place. All I know is that I awoke the next morning with very few memories of the previous night, and a geisha who knew far too much senstive information." - An unnamed magistrate

card.name: Large Farm
card.text:
Farm
Bow this card: Produce 2 Gold.
card.flavor:
"There is no court, no army, no temple in the entire Empire that does not depend upon the bounty provided by simple, hard-working farmers." - Isawa Tamaki

"It is the desire of every simple farmer to succeed and experience great wealth. The problem with such a thing is that achieving said goal only attracts the greater interest of the samurai, which is rarely a good thing." - An unnamed farmer

"Assure our people that greater productivity is required," Nitoshi said. "Our loyal and brave soldiers are fighting a war in a distant land, and they need supplies. The lower castes must do their part. No exceptions."

"A thousand samurai can be sacrificed without hesitation, but only a fool sacrifices farms." - Yogo Haruto

"I speak of a samurai's own farming vassals, of course. If the Phoenix are too foolish to protect their assets, then they do not deserve for them to survive." - Yogo Haruto

"A farm of this size must surely provide an entire squadron of Phoenix warriors with food enough to fight, if not more. Put it to the torch. Leave nothing but ash." - Yogo Haruto

card.name: Remote Village
card.text:
Farm
Bow this card: Produce 3 Gold.
card.flavor:
The snow-capped peaks and deep forests of the northeast hide a great many farms and settlements, more than any enemy has ever truly discovered.

"It is these gentle secrets, these hidden treasures, that we fight for, as surely as we fight for our own honor. Let us always remember that, and take strength from it." - Shiba Mitsushen

The peasants worked diligently, as they did each and every day. The only pause came as they heard a strange, distant sound. It was not long before the sight of Scorpion troops on the horizon was reported.

"Small settlements hidden in the rural regions are perfect for concealing things outsiders need not see." - Bayushi Nitoshi

"If you have a thing you wish hidden, some believe that in plain sight is best. Personally, I believe that you should place it not only where no one will look, but where no one will even care." - Shosuro Konishi

"I trust the Scorpion not at all. Are these simple, innocent villages? I hardly think anything within the Scorpion lands is innocent. If they wished to be safe, they should never have put our lands to the torch." - Isawa Taiken

card.name: Rice Paddy
card.text:
Farm
Bow this card: Produce 2 Gold.
Battle: Bow and destroy this card, and target an attacking Follower at one of your provinces' battlefields: Bow it.
card.flavor:
For some, simple communion with the land is the greatest state of harmony that can be desired.

The Scorpion general handed his scouts a small bottle. "Add this to the waters of the paddies and it will not matter if we are defeated. The farms will not produce for quite some time."

Rice is the lifeblood of an Empire. So much so, in fact, that Rokugan's traditional greeting can be translated as "Have you had rice today?"

card.name: Silk Works
card.text: Bow this card: Produce 4 Gold.
card.flavor:
Some value precious metals or building materials, but there will always be those who appreciate the small luxuries of life.

Born in a tiny village in a backwater province, Takiko would have spent her whole life in obscurity but for one thing: purely by chance, it was discovered that she possessed an unparalleled gift for working with silk. It is said her work was like wearing the garb of the Heavens. - The Tale of Takiko, Part I

In time, Takiko's work became a sensation throughout the Empire. Countless courtiers sought her out to commission her work, so much so that she could not possibly keep pace. When one was politely refused, the irritable samurai killed Takiko outright, denying the Empire one of its greatest treasures - The Tale of Takiko, Part II

card.name: Silver Mine
card.text:
Mine
Bow this card: Produce 2 Gold, or 3 Gold if you are a Phoenix Clan player.
card.flavor:
"Like the Phoenix in whose lands it is plentiful, silver is versatile and valuable. One can craft it into deadly weapons or intricate works of art. I would not question the worth of either." - Daidoji Kenshi

Nairuko sighed happily. "Can you feel it?" she asked the shugenja students around her. "The feel of the silver deep within the earth? It feels like joy."

"I regret the order, my friend, but we must resume a summer schedule in the mines. The Scorpion have plagued our supplies to the point that we desperately require additional funding." - Shiba Tsukimi

card.name: Small Farm
card.text:
Farm
Bow this card: Produce 1 Gold.
card.flavor:
A single meager farm contributes only a tiny fraction of the yield a Great Clan requires. Alone, they are insignificant. Together, they are essential.

"For all that their complaints have merit, however, the Phoenix are hardly blameless. There was little loss of life in the Phoenix attack on the southern Scorpion provinces, but the devastation visited upon the lands themselves was significant indeed." - The Miya Histories

"The atrocities commited by the Scorpion during their incursion into the Phoenix lands are without measure. Generations will feel the pain of the war, for no reason other than to teach some presumed lesson. The villainy of Yogo Haruto shall be a thing of legend." - The Miya Histories

"I see men die to make our lands safe, and peasants work themselves to death to feed great armies. Who protects whom?" - Bayushi Utoro

"There are many in the Empire who slander our masters, but in truth, they are the kindest and most understanding lords I have ever served. They understand the realities of the world, where the others see only an impossible ideal." - An unnamed farmer

"It is difficult to imagine that the fate of armies, of clans, of the entire Empire, can rest on the shoulders of such seemingly insignificant places such as this. The Heavens are not without a sense of irony." - Yogo Haruto

card.name: Hida Bushotsu
card.text: Crab Clan • Berserker
card.flavor:
"You call them villains, but what I know of the Scorpion is this: they alone understand the plight of the Crab Clan, and they have always proven themselves worthy to be called our allies.

The Crab warrior lifted Bayushi Irezu to his feet. "I think there might be something wrong with your mind, friend. I have seen demons with more sense of self-preservation."
Irezu only laughed.

card.name: Daidoji Kenshi
card.text: Crane Clan • Samurai • Iron Crane • Scout
card.flavor: "The bond between our clans is strong, Tamaki-sama. My kinsmen have lent my skills to you and yours. I suggest you make great use of them, for rarely will you have an opportunity of this nature."

card.name: Tamori Kusugi
card.text:
Dragon Clan • Earth • Shugenja • Soul of Tamori Sugi
Battle: Even if Kusugi is not at the current battlefield, bow him: Raise or lower the current battlefield's province's strength by 4 (until the turn ends).
card.flavor:
"Do no fear, cousins. Your neighbors among the Dragon will not soon forget the bond we share. And we have our own way with the elements..."

"I am sorry, friend Scorpion. I would spare you the ignominy of this defeat, but it was you who brought war to these lands."

card.name: Isawa Tamaki
card.text:
Phoenix Clan • Void • Shugenja • Ishiken • Soul of Isawa Hachiko
Limited: Look at the top card of your Fate deck. You may put it at the bottom of the deck.
card.flavor:
"I trust in the power of truth, and that the honor of the courts will overcome all else, no matter how many liars' tongues say otherwise."

"That's... it... you're bluffing!" the Crab courtier sputtered. "You could not possibly know something like that!"
Tamaki only smiled.

"She moves like a phantom through the halls of the Imperial Court. Others respect her, perhaps even fear her, but they do not understand her, I think." - Shiba Jikaro

card.name: Natsumi
card.text:
Phoenix Clan • Nonhuman • Ryu • Water • Shugenja
Will not attach Followers or Items.
Battle: Even if Natsumi is bowed: If it would be opposed (and has not been attacking in a resolution this Attack Phase), move it to the current battlefield. Straighten its unit if it moved.
card.flavor:
The Phoenix possess a kinship with the universe that few clans can hope to match.

"The Heavens parted and a dragon poured forth like water. I hope I never see the Phoenix lands again." - A Scorpion soldier

"I find your prayers and offerings pleasing, little humans. What boon would you ask in return?"

card.name: Bayushi Irezu
card.text:
Scorpion Clan • Bitter Lies • Martyr • Soul of Bayushi Kwanchai
Battle: If Irezu is at home, target another Scorpion Clan Personality you control: Move him home. Move Irezu to the current battlefield.
Reaction: Before your Scorpion Clan Personality enters a duel, bow Irezu: He enters the duel instead.

card.name: Bayushi Manami
card.text: Scorpion Clan • Samurai • Paragon • Yojimbo • Loyal
card.flavor:
"The other Great Clans see a Scorpion and they believe they know what to expect. They believe we are all villains, assassins, or poison masters. When they face me, they will find only death at the end of a blade."

"Clinging to a vestige of honor or conscience might seem to give a man strength, but in truth it merely weakens him. Better to cast aside such things and be free of doubt or remorse." - Bayushi Nitoshi

card.name: Shosuro Konishi
card.text:
Scorpion Clan • Ninja
Battle: Ranged 5 Attack.
card.flavor:
"I, and those like me, are a lie wrapped in the truth. Layer upon layer of deception, each more convoluted than the last, until my enemies know not what to think when they look upon me. They die confused."

The youngest students of the Shosuro are dressed in black and sent out as a distraction for the clan's enemies. Those who survive are trained in the true secrets of the arts. Some return to the black attire, finding it a suitable tool for a true warrior.

card.name: Clearing Crew
card.text:
Ashigaru
After this card enters play from your hand: Draw an additional card during your next End Phase.
card.flavor:
"Few clans have ashigaru legions who are as devoted to their masters as the Phoenix. Inconvenient, but ultimately forgettable." - Yogo Haruto

In addition to their duties in the wars of the Empire, many ashigaru legions have been employed clearing the vegetation and vermin of the Colonies, that Rokugan might expand its borders.

"Have you seen the size of these bugs? I would rather go back to the front lines!"

card.name: Native Guide
card.flavor:
"For centuries, we have embraced the belief that those born outside the Emerald Empire were so different from us that they could not be considered human. Perhaps we should reconsider that belief." - Shiba Tsukimi

"I must disagree, Tsukimi-same," Isawa Norimichi interjected. "We have held parlay with the Yobanjin tribes for generations, but only becuase they share the same ancestors we do. Other gaijin cultures are decidedly less... civilized."

"The fact that the forces of the Empire now occupy foreign lands cannot be ignored," Isawa Kimi observed. "Even if we wish to avoid contamination by gaijin cultures, can we afford to risk that lost culture's secrets falling into the hands of another clan?"

"The Phoenix have a history of tentative contact with the Yobanjin tribes to the north, although they prefer to keep their interaction with the gaijin quiet." Nitoshi tapped his chin with his fan as he thought. "See to it that proof of this contact reaches the courts. Give the Phoenix something else to worry about."

"The greater interaction of our people with gaijin has caused doubts and questions among their ranks. This weakens them and renders them simpler to manipulate." - Bayushi Nitoshi

card.name: Devoted Yojimbo
card.text:
Yojimbo
Battle: Bow one of your Personalities or Followers in this army and target a Personality or Follower in this army: Straighten it.
card.flavor:
A Phoenix warrior devotes himself fully to the safety of another. It is the ultimate act of courage and selflessness.

"Move, my lord!" the yojimbo shouted, shouldering him aside. The assailant's blow was narrowly avoided.

"You will not take the life of my lord," the yojimbo said, steel in his voice. "You made your best attempt, and it was lacking. Now you will face the consequences."

card.name: Hired Legion
card.text:
Unique
Battle: Bow this card: Draw a card.
card.flavor: "Hello, my friends!" Irezu laughed. "Today we will fight and die far from home in the name of a lord who will never know our names! Haha! Is life not grand?"

card.name: Seppun Heavy Elite
card.text:
Imperial • Elite
(Elite cards contribute Force even if bowed.)
This Personality has Elite.
card.flavor:
The involvement of Imperial units on both sides was extremely limited. No commander wished to risk dishonor at their questionable use.

"There was an incident where two Seppun units nearly faced one another on the field. Both clans withdrew to avoid such an embarassment." - Bayushi Manami

"Imperial units are like an ancient, venerable blade. It can be of tremendous use in battle, but it must be wielded carefully to avoid damaging it, for the consequences would be dire." - Bayushi Manami

card.name: Veteran Skirmishers
card.flavor:
"In the year 1173, at the end of the Destroyer War, the Empress bade the Spider Clan to depart from the Empire and bring order to the ruined Ivory Kingdoms, that the people of Rokugan might once again know peace and prosperity." - The Miya Histories

"With the departure of the Spider Clan, the Empire entered into an unprecedented period of spiritual rebirth and serenity. The Phoenix Clan ushered in this period as the stewards of the Empire's spirit, aided as ever by the philosophical monk teachers of the Dragon Clan." - The Miya Histories

"The War of the Twins is generally regarded as the end of this period of tranquility, for the debates that ensued as a result of the conflict divided the Great Clans in courts across the lands. These disagreements brought forth older, more serious issues that would later prove problematic." - The Miya Histories

card.name: Wave Man
card.text:
Ronin
Will only attach to a Samurai.
After an Attack Phase ends: Straighten this unit.
card.flavor:
"The greatest value of a ronin is that no one cares if he lives or dies." - Yogo Haruto

"Dishonorable? What do I care? A Scorpion's coin keeps me fed as well as any other. If the Phoenix do not like it, they should have hired me first."

"I look upon them and see what I once was. I look upon them and all I feel is pity." - Tsubo

card.name: Akodo Regulars
card.text: Battle: Discard a card: Give this card a Force bonus equal to the discarded card's Focus Value (until the turn ends).
card.flavor:
"The interventionist tendencies of the Phoenix must be discouraged, even if it means siding with the Scorpion to do so." - Akodo Shihiro

Lion forces continued to serve as an honor guard in the City of Remembrance in the Phoenix lands. In the absence of orders to the contrary from their lord, they were honor-bound to take up arms to defend Phoenix lands, even if it meant potentially facing their brothers in battle.

card.name: Cleansing the Path
card.text:
Fire
Battle: Destroy this card: Ranged 4 Attack, or Ranged 5 Attack if the performing Shugenja is Fire.
card.flavor:
"Others may call us weak, but we have a proud history of defending the Empire. When Rokugan was besieged by the dead during the Plague War, it was our fire that cleansed the land." - Isawa Taiken

"Life should be preserved at all costs, for it is precious beyond our understanding. The undead, however, are an abomination. Purge every trace of their existence from the mortal realm." - Isawa Kimi

Despite two decades having passed since the end of the Destroyer War, pockets of the plague-dead occaisionally still arise. When such things happen, the Phoenix are often consulted.

card.name: Conflagration
card.text:
Fire
While this Shugenja is Fire, Ranged Attacks from actions he performs have +1 strength.
Battle: Bow this card: Give this Shugenja +3F (until the turn ends).
card.flavor:
"A small force of Phoenix, led by Isawa Taiken and advancing from the Crane lands, approached the city of Shutai. None could know the devastation they brought with them." - The Death of Shutai, Part I

"The attack came utterly without warning. The city might have been razed almost instantly, but for the Phoenix attackers' intent to allow those who wished to flee to do so." - The Death of Shutai, Part II

"The people of the city fled, save those who insisted upon fighting to defend their homes. Of the city itself, virtually nothing remains. The Firestorm Legion was nothing if not thorough." - The Death of Shutai, Part III

card.name: Contemplate the Void
card.text:
Void
Limited: Bow this Shugenga, destroy this card, and discard your hand (even if empty): Draw four cards.
card.flavor:
"The Void is beyond description. It is everything and nothing. It is all elements, and none of them. To touch the Void is to merge your soul with the fabric of the world and lose yourself within it." - Isawa Tamaki

"The only limit that exists within the Void is the limit we place upon ourselves. Unfortunately, I have discovered that prolonged contact with the Imperial Courts can be quite limiting indeed." - Isawa Tamaki

card.name: Earth's Embrace
card.text:
Earth
Attaches to an Earth Shugenja paying 2 less Gold.
Battle: Bow this card: Give each of your Shugenja in this army +1F (until the turn ends).
card.flavor:
"Stone fortifications erected to keep out the Phoenix are utterly pointless, I assure you." - Isawa Nairuko

The Scorpion officer howled in frustration. "Get me through this wall!" he roared. "I do not care how!"

The enemy's attack was fearsome and relentless. It made no difference whatsoever.

card.name: Scouring Flood
card.text:
Water
This Personality has +2F.
Battle: Bow this card and target a defending Personality: Move him home.
card.flavor:
"You are not welcome here, my friends. Let me escort you from the valley. Brace yourselves, if you please."

The shouts of victory from the Scorpion troops soon turned to shouts of alarm as the roar of approaching water drown out the din of battle.

"I have devoted my life to the intracacies of fire, but even I must admit... that was quite amusing." - Isawa Taiken

card.name: Servitors of Stone
card.text:
Earth
Battle: Bow this card and target a card in this Shugenja's army: Straighten it.
card.flavor:
"Magic does not exist purely to destroy. It can create, entertain, and inspire. To focus only on the destructive is the greatest of tragedies." - Isawa Nairuko

Amid the Scorpion camp, the tiny swirl of stones went unnoticed. When they flew together and began moving toward the army's command tent, no one was any the wiser.

A tiny stone man handed the shugenja a scroll. "Thank you, little one," he said absently, deep in comminion with the earth.

card.name: The Towers of the Yogo
card.text: Each of your Scorpion Clan Personalities has the ability, "Battle: Bow this card and target an enemy Follower or Personality without Followers: Bow it."
card.flavor: The Scorpion lands lie in the center of the Empire, like a blade held close to the heart, ever ready for the killing blow.

card.name: Back to the Front
card.text: Battle: Choose your performing Personality: Move him to a battlefield he assigned to this turn. If he moved, straighten his unit.
card.flavor:
"Have you ever seen a warrior, battered and bloodied from a dozen wounds, refuse to rest? To see him return to the front to protect his brothers? That is greatness." - Shiba Mitsushen

Taiken gazed at the yojimbo in shock. "I thought you were dead!" The Shiba kicked away the dead Scorpion, both covered in blood. "I would not... abandon my duties... so easily," he gasped.

"A brief reprieve, my friends," Taiken said to the troops as they re-entered the Crane lands. "Rest while you can. Soon, the Scorpion will feel our wrath again."

"My vassals fight to the last drop of blood, and then they gather their strength and return to fight again. How can I help but feel the same loyalty to them that they feel for me?" - Bayushi Nitoshi

"Mutual loyalty is all very good, but I prefer to serve my lord in a more intelligent manner. The soldiers I sacrifice will meet their kharma and you, Nitoshi-sama, will have the destruction you desire." - Yogo Haruto

"The Scorpion fight like madmen. I suppose that is appropriate, considering who their lord is. Dying in combat would be a hundred times better than having to address Bayushi Nitoshi with respect." - Shiba Sawaken

card.name: Block Supply Lines
card.text: Battle: Target an attacking Personality: Move him home. If he moved, bow his unit.
card.flavor:
"Is this true?" Shihiro demanded, throwing the scroll at the feet of the Scorpion general. "Did you make the Lion party to this sickening disgrace?"
Haruto had no visible reaction. "Does my answer matter one way or another?"

Shihiro's eyes narrowed. "What is your business here, Dragon?" The Kitsuki bowed deeply. "My lords felt that the Lion would wish to have a full accounting of the death of Shiba Mitsushen," she said, and held forth a scroll sealed with a Dragon mon.

"That is unfortunate," Konishi said as the Lion departed from the Scorpion camp. "They are fools, but excellent soldiers."
"They are unimportant," Haruto said with a wave. "Their departure was inevitable, and has long been anticipated."

card.name: Crushing Strength
card.text:
Battle: Target your opposed Personality: Give him +3F (until the turn ends).
Battle: Target an enemy Follower or Item: Destroy it.
card.flavor:
"Waging war in the midst of winter, particularly the harsh Phoenix winters, is an intriguing proposition. I am eager to see what possibilities arise." - Yogo Haruto

"The Scorpion know nothing of our winters. They know nothing of how to cope with the suffering and misery they bring. It is a tactical mistake, and they will deeply regret it." - Shiba Mitsushen

Nitoshi wiped at his mouth with a napkin. "I want to see at least one family bloodied. I want to see their homes in ruins."
Haruto smiled and bowed. "You shall see that much and more, my lord."

"What is the situation at Kyuden Agasha?" Shiba Tsukimi demanded. The messenger kneeling before her could only weep in reply.

"This is not war, this is butchery," Akodo Shichiro said. "It is, however, very efficient butchery."

card.name: Fall Back!
card.text: Battle: Choose your performing Personality: Move him home. If he moved, straighten his unit, and you may straighten one of your other units (at any location).
card.flavor:
"Signal my commanders," Shiba Mitsushen said. He tapped the map spread out before him. "We will break off and reform our lines here."

"Now is the time," Akodo Shichiro said. "We shall crush them as they flee!"
"Patience," Yogo Haruto said. "This is a maneuver on their part, not a rout."

"Now! Now let them come at us!" Shiba Jikaro said. "We shall show them that steel is as plentiful in our lands as silver."

card.name: Incapacitated
card.text: Battle: Target a defending Personality: Move him home.
card.flavor:
"Sometimes it is advantageous for an enemy to survive, but they need to be temporarliy removed from the scenario. A well placed strike can ensure both of these things are enacted perfectly." - Shosuro Chikata

"My unit would be far more useful to the Phoenix if my brothers-in-arms didn't keep dropping from traps, inexplicable accidents, and mysteriously bad rice. I am starting to understand, and sympathize with, the Mantis dislike of the Daidoji." - From the pillowbook of Daidoji Kenshi

card.name: Inspirational Address
card.text: Battle: Choose your performing Personality and target a Follower in your hand or discard pile: Attach it to him, paying 1 less Gold.
card.flavor:
"Listen to the thunder - it growls out the anger of the Heavens against the Scorpion! Feel the rain - heaven itself weeps in fury at their crimes! Tomorrow we will face the Scorpion on the field of battle and show heaven that we share its anger!" - Shiba Mitsushen

"Tomorrow we will wage battle against the Phoenix. Should we win - and I strongly encourage you not to disappoint me in this - Nitoshi-sama will soon afterwards humble the Phoenix. You have your orders." - Yogo Haruto

"We get to fight in a thunderstorm! Maybe someone will get struck by lightning while they are raising their blade to finish off their greatest enemy! Wouldn't that be exciting!" - Bayushi Irezu

card.name: Never Afraid
card.text: Battle: Target an attachment: Destroy it.
card.flavor:
"Come for me, if you wish, and bring as many as you like. You are unworthy to inspire fear in my warrior's heart."

Tsubo knocked aside the first blade with his staff, then whirled around to smash the second man in the ribs. As the warrior dropped his sword in pain Tsubo stepped in calmly and hit him in the face.

"Are you no better than this? Why should I draw my sword when you cannot even fight an old man with a staff?"

card.name: Prepared for Death
card.text: Limited: Choose your performing Personality: Give him +2F (until the turn ends).
card.flavor:
"If the Phoenix had but tended to their own affairs and left others to theirs, then none of this would have been necessary. These deaths, all of them, are on their heads." - Hida Bushotsu

"What is death to a phoenix? We must show the acceptance of that noble spirit in all of our actions. We will do what we feel is necessary in this world, and meet the consequences without flinching." - Shiba Mitsushen

card.name: Treachery and Deceit
card.text: Battle: Target a Personality whose unit's total Force is 7 or higher: Move him home.
card.flavor:
"The radiant Lady of the Phoenix, Shiba Tsukimi, was flawless on the day of the duel. Her form was perfect. Her style without equal. If she can be said to have had any flaw, it was that her honor did not permit her to anticipate treachery." - Shiba Sawaken, The Tale of the Duel I

The disgrace of the Scorpion Champion is without measure, but cannot be spoken of outside our lands. His lies, the poison in his very soul, would be unleashed upon us once again. Read, my brothers. Read, and know the enemy." - Shiba Sawaken, The Tale of the Duel II

card.name: One Shout
card.text: Battle: Choose your performing opposed Personality: Give him +2F, or +4F if he has an attachment (until the turn ends).
card.flavor:
One shout. One thousand voices.

"More than one thousand years ago, the Shiba swore an oath to defend the Isawa with our lives," Mitsushen said, his words echoing across the field to his troops. "Today I intend to honor that promise. Who stands beside me?"

card.name: Hida Yamadera - exp
card.text:
Crab Clan • Shadowlands • Berserker • Damned • Experienced • Unique
Reaction: After another player's Battle action resolves, if its effects destroyed Yamadera: Melee 8 Attack.
card.flavor: "My curse is to live. I live when all others die. To take one's own life is a Crab's greatest cowardice. I must live to find that which can kill me."

card.name: Doji Dainagon - exp
card.text:
Crane Clan • Imperial • Courtier • Experienced • Unique
Political Open: Take the Imperial Favor.
card.flavor: "Some enjoy the trials of life, and others prefer to immerse themselves in games. The truth is that the greatest joy is in the games life offers us."

card.name: Togashi Korimi - exp2
card.text:
Dragon Clan • Earth • Monk • Tattooed • Experienced 2 • Unique
Limited: Draw a card.
card.flavor: "The distractions of the physical world are an obstacle we must overcome to reach the truth of enlightenment. Conflict, debate, politics, even clothing can stand in our path."

card.name: Jade's Roar - exp
card.text:
Lion Clan • Nonhuman • Lion • Scout • Experienced Pride of the Hand • Unique • Legendary
Recon Reaction: After engaging at Jade Roar's battlefield: You have Reconnaissance there. You have the first opportunity to take a Battle action in this battle, which must be a Terrain action.
card.flavor: "The beast can appear anywhere in the Empire, and even the Colonies, carrying out the will of its mistress. There are many mysteries in the world, but I find the Jade Hand the most intriguing." - Ikoma Hagio

card.name: Moshi Madoka - exp
card.text:
Mantis Clan • Thunder • Shugenja • Scout • Experienced • Unique
Limited: If you have attached a card from your hand this turn, bow Madoka: Draw a card.
card.flavor: "Do not mistake my demeanor for weakness. I embrace tradition and decorum, but Thunder speaks through me just as loudly as my sisters. Do not provoke its voice."

card.name: Kunji - exp
card.text:
Phoenix Clan • Nonhuman • Fenghuang • Fire • Shugenja • Cavalry • Experienced • Unique
Open: If Kunji is honorably dead: Bring it into play, ignoring costs if you are a Phoenix Clan player.
card.flavor: "An old friend who once aided our clan when we needed it most has returned. What terrible things must loom on the horizon for the Phoenix?" - Shiba Tsukimi

card.name: Shosuro Hawado - exp2
card.text:
Scorpion Clan • Ninja • Shadowspawn • Experienced 2 • Unique
Limited: Target a card in a province: Discard it. Refill the province face-up.
card.flavor: "I dispatched her to the Colonies to make use of her gifts. She remains there because I have begun to find her gifts... unsettling." - Shosuro Keirei

card.name: Daigotsu Negishi - exp
card.text:
Spider Clan • Shadowlands • Samurai • Commander • Conqueror • Experienced • Loyal • Unique
After Negishi enters play: Lose 2 Honor.
Negate Negishi's destruction from effects of actions performed by any Personality whose unit's total Gold Cost was lower than Negishi's unit's (when they performed it).
card.flavor: "I am well pleased with your service, Negishi-san. I have a task that I need to entrust to a worthy vassal. Have you the courage for such a thing?" - Daigostu Kanpeki

card.name: Shinjo Byung - exp
card.text:
Unicorn Clan • Samurai • Cavalry • Tactician • Experienced • Unique
Reaction: After a Tactical Battle action resolves that Byung performed: Take an additional Battle action.
card.flavor: "Our Empire endured a war with a gaijin demon goddess. It cannot be torn apart by mere human frailty. It would be an insult to all who have bled and dies to save it."

card.name: Buried Treasures
card.text:
Market • Retainer • Unique
Bow this card: Produce 2 Gold.
Limited: If you have four or fewer cards in your hand and you are a Mantis Clan player, bow this card: Draw a card.
card.flavor: Even after two decades, great treasures remain hidden away in the Colonies. Some consider it their divine mandate to inherit such treasures.

card.name: Purveyor of Questionable Goods
card.text:
Market • Retainer • Unique
Bow this card: Produce 2 Gold.
Limited: If you have four or fewer cards in your hand and you are a Spider Clan player, bow this card: Draw a card.
card.flavor: "Good day, my friend! I know, the trouble at the Second City is most inconvenient, but I think I have what you need right here!"

card.name: Tattoos & Trinkets
card.text:
Market • Retainer • Unique
Bow this card: Produce 2 Gold.
Limited: If you have four or fewer cards in your hand and you are a Dragon Clan player, bow this card: Draw a card.
card.flavor: "We are nothing but a collection of memories. Should you wish to commemorate even the most insignificant of events, I can assist you."

card.name: The Daidoji Marketplace
card.text:
Market • Retainer • Unique
Bow this card: Produce 2 Gold.
Limited: If you have four or fewer cards in your hand and you are a Crane Clan player, bow this card: Draw a card.
card.flavor: The conflict between the Crane and the Mantis has lessened trade in Twin Forks City, but only slightly. Commerce endures, no matter the circumstances.

card.name: The Ide Caravan
card.text:
Market • Retainer • Unique
Bow this card: Produce 2 Gold.
Limited: If you have four or fewer cards in your hand and you are a Unicorn Clan player, bow this card: Draw a card.
card.flavor: "It is not my business, of course, but why would you ever ship materials by sea? The humid air alone can destroy such delicate treasures!"

card.name: The Merchant's District
card.text:
Market • Retainer • Unique
Bow this card: Produce 2 Gold.
Limited: If you have four or fewer cards in your hand and you are a Scorpion Clan player, bow this card: Draw a card.
card.flavor: "A samurai finds commerce unpleasant, certainly, and yet they require it to live. It makes it a simple matter for us to gather information on them." - Shosuro Tanzaki

card.name: The Mystical Merchant
card.text:
Market • Retainer • Unique
Bow this card: Produce 2 Gold.
Limited: If you have four or fewer cards in your hand and you are a Phoenix Clan player, bow this card: Draw a card.
card.flavor: "Many secrets were lost in this place. We are the Phoenix. It is our duty to find them, understand them, and ensure no one is lost to them." - Agasha Kurou

card.name: The Quartermaster's Depot
card.text:
Market • Retainer • Unique
Bow this card: Produce 2 Gold.
Limited: If you have four or fewer cards in your hand and you are a Lion Clan player, bow this card: Draw a card.
card.flavor: "The circumstances are irrelevant. The Lion wage war for the Empress, and the rest of us do whatever we must to ensure that the armies have what they require."

card.name: The Yasuki Peddler
card.text:
Market • Retainer • Unique
Bow this card: Produce 2 Gold.
Limited: If you have four or fewer cards in your hand and you are a Crab Clan player, bow this card: Draw a card.
card.flavor: "I have precisely what you need. You say you do not need anything? That is only because you have not yet seen what my brother and I offer, good sir!"

card.name: Jiramu's Court
card.text:
Bow this card: Produce 2 Gold.
Open: Bow this card and target your Courtier: Straighten him.
card.flavor: "This is the court of one of our family's most venerable sensei. Stand here and know that you stand in the presence of honor and greatness." - Seppun Ritisharu

card.name: Seppun Jiramu
card.text:
Imperial • Courtier • Samurai • Sensei
After Jiramu enters play: Discard all your other Sensei Personalities.
Your provinces have +2 strength.
You may use the Proclaim action twice per turn.
card.flavor: "We are Seppun. Our duty is to protect, but we must not be weak in the courts of Rokugan."

card.name: Sadahako's Artistry
card.text:
Fortune • Unique
Limited: If your Family Honor is 10 or lower: Gain 1 Honor.
Limited: Discard this card and target a card in your hand: You offer it as a gift. Show it to another player. He may accept, putting it into his hand; if he did, you gain Honor equal to its Focus Value. If he did not, discard it and draw 3 cards.

card.name: Hachiman's Prowess
card.text:
Fortune • Unique
Limited: Once per game, target your Personality: While this card remains in play, he has Elite and the trait, "May assign even if bowed." (Elite cards contribute Force while bowed.)
Battle: Discard this card and target your Personality: Straighten his unit.
card.flavor: "Stand up, there is still glory to win!"

card.name: Kurohito's Perfection
card.text:
Fortune • Unique
When paying the cost of the rulebook Favor Political Limited action: You may ignore the cost of discarding a card; if you did, delay its effects until your End Phase begins.
Limited: Discard this card and target a Personality: Permanently give him Cavalry, Duelist, or Tactician.

card.name: Rejected Mediation
card.text:
Unique
Any player who controls the Imperial Favor discards it. Until your second turn from now begins, negate the effects of the first Political action taken each turn.
card.flavor: Suikihime's serene mask slipped for a brief moment as she read the missive. "Prepare our defenses," she ordered. "They are coming."

card.name: Harbingers of War
card.text:
Unique
Until the game ends, equipping Followers and Items from your hand with a base Gold Cost of 1 to 4 is a Battle/Open action for you and, after the first time each turn you do so, draw a card.
card.flavor:
"How could they march against us?"
"I do not know, but the Second City must know that the Legions are on the way!"

card.name: Unseasonable Weather
card.text:
Unique
Until your next turn begins, after each time a Personality is assigned to attack, negate his straightening during his controller's next Straighten Phase (after he assigns).
card.flavor: Neither side wished to let loose the first blood, and the constant rain only served to further dampen the mood.

card.name: A Dangerous Game
card.text:
Unique
You may discard your hand (even if it is empty). If you did, draw four cards.
card.flavor: He reached for the results with a trembling hand. If the Moon Die showed Void, his entire fortune was lost.

card.name: Revelations
card.text:
Unique
Show the top five cards of your Dynasty deck. Choose another player who may discard one of the cards. Put the rest back in any order. Refill this province face-up.
card.flavor: A sense of bemusement filled the air. "These trifling actions of men have nothing to do with me," the dragon said.

card.name: Damaged Port
card.text:
Port
Bow this card: Produce 2 Gold, or 4 Gold if paying for a Holding.
card.flavor: The sudden attack from the Crane decimated the docks of Kalani's Landing. Undeterred, the Mantis found other options.

card.name: Vast Paddy Fields
card.text:
Farm
Bow this card: Produce 2 Gold. If this paid for a Farm Holding entering play from a province, refill the province face-up.
card.flavor: Generations of farmers struggled to cultivate the lands, knowing that they would never reap the fruits. Decades later, tiered rice terraces breathtakingly spanned the lands.

card.name: Green Lake Dojo
card.text:
Dojo
Bow this card: Produce 2 Gold.
Open: Bow this card, destroy it if it is your turn, and target a Personality: Give him Cavalry.
card.flavor: "And what is taught here, Shichiro-sama?" "Cavalry tactics," the sensei replied. Moshi Ira looked around. "I see no horses." Shichiro smiled.

card.name: Hero's Memorial
card.text:
Singular
Reaction: After another player's action resolves which destroyed one of your Personalities, bow this card: Gain 2 Honor.
card.flavor: Togashi Noboru bowed. "I will not forget." His promise crashed against the walls and carried across the dome of the heavens.

card.name: The Tachikaze
card.text:
Boat • Retainer
After an action resolves whose effects destroyed your Follower with a Gold Cost of 1 or more: You may put it face-up under this card.
Battle/Limited: Any number of times per turn, target your Personality: Attach a Follower from under this card to him, paying all costs.
card.flavor: "I want them scuttled." - Yoritomo Hiromi

card.name: Merchant Outpost
card.text:
Market • Port
Bow this card: Produce 2 Gold.
Limited: Target a card in a province and bow this card if the target is not yours: Turn it face-up.
card.flavor: Some transactions are better orchestrated away from civilization.

card.name: Miryoku no Shima
card.text:
Bow this card: Produce 5 Gold.
Open: Choose your two performing Personalities: A lesson is taught. One copies Commander, Duelist, Kensai, Magistrate, Paragon, Scout, or Yojimbo from the other.
card.flavor: "An estate belonging to both the Dragon and Crane, a chance for both clans to learn from each other in the name of peace."

card.name: The Forgotten Bay Dojo
card.text:
Dojo
Bow this card: Produce 3 Gold.
Battle: Target a Follower with a Gold Cost of 1 or more: Raise its Force to 4.
card.flavor: Away from the eyes of the Empire, the samurai of the Forgotten Bay are free to train as they please. But to remain unseen, it must remain forgotten.

card.name: Hida Chiyurei
card.text: Crab Clan • Berserker • Tactician
card.flavor: "There's a time for attack and a time for planning. Lucky for me, most of my plans tend to involve attacking."

card.name: Hiruma Ikeuchi
card.text:
Crab Clan • Imperial • Samurai • Scout • Yojimbo
Before the first time each battle any of Ikeuchi's Followers are destroyed by another player's card's effect: If you have Reconaissance, negate the destruction of one such Follower.
card.flavor: He throws himself into comabt with reckless abandon, yet his troops follow him with unshakable trust.

card.name: Kaiu Nagai
card.text:
Crab Clan • Samurai • Siege • Tactician
While Nagai is defending, he has Elite (Elite cards contribute Force even if bowed).
card.flavor: "The Shadowlands might have fallen quiet in recent years, but we cannot afford to grow lax."

card.name: Kuni Renyu - exp
card.text:
Crab Clan • Daimyo • Earth • Jade • Shugenja • Witch Hunter • Experienced • Loyal • Unique
Your provinces have +2 strength.
Your other Personalities with a base Gold Cost of 5 or higher enter play paying 2 less Gold.
card.flavor: "My loyalty lies with my clan and the Empress, none other."

card.name: Kuni Shinoda - exp
card.text:
Crab Clan • Earth • Shugenja • Hero • Tactician • Experienced • Unique
Battle: Target an enemy card: Bow it. If it is Shadowlands, destroy it.
card.flavor: His victory over the Onyx Champion has only strengthened his resolve to destroy the Shadowlands.

card.name: Yasuki Daito
card.text:
Crab Clan • Courtier • Merchant
Limited: Bow Daito or pay 4 Gold, and target a Personality: Daito bribes him. Negate the target's straightening until after the next Straighten Phase ends.
card.flavor: "Perhaps you can overlook this error once?"

card.name: Asahina Nanae - exp
card.text:
Crane Clan • Air • Jade • Shugenja • Experienced • Unique • Jade Champion
Battle/Open: Even if Nanae is bowed, target a Personality: You may straighten him. You may give him -4F. Bow him if he is Shadowlands.
card.flavor: "Indeed, I am aware of the many conflicts in the Empire, but I am the Jade Champion. I will never forget what my first duty to the Empire is."

card.name: Asahina Akahiko
card.text:
Crane Clan • Air • Shugenja • Cavalry
Melee and Ranged Attacks targeting Akahiko have -4 strength.
Battle: Target an enemy Personality: Move him and Akahiko home. Gain 1 Honor.
card.flavor: "Many times you have served the clan by protecting me, kinsman. Now it is time for me to serve the clan."

card.name: Daidoji Ibara
card.text:
Crane Clan • Samurai • Iron Crane • Scout
Battle: Target an enemy Personality or Follower: Move Ibara to oppose it. If she now opposes it, give it -3F and, if it is Mantis Clan, bow it.
card.flavor: "There are so few of us here, so few. But if I must do the work of two in order to defend the Crane, then that is what I will do."

card.name: Doji Tatsuzo
card.text:
Crane Clan • Courtier
Political Open: Target a Personality: While he is at the current battlefield (later this turn), you may take a Battle action even if you control no units there. After that action ends, end this action's effects on him.
card.flavor: "Can you deny the testimony of your own eyes? Not even monasteries are safe from the greed of the Mantis! Shall the Empire tolerate this brutish violence any longer?"

card.name: Doji Iza
card.text:
Crane Clan • Samurai • Duelist • Magistrate
Open: Target another player's Mirumoto Kyoshiro: Iza duels him. Destroy the duel's loser.
card.flavor: "Kyoshiro, I've tried overlooking your insolence for the good of both our clans. But if you are so determined to die, well then I will be happy to oblige you."

card.name: Doji Kazuo - exp
card.text:
Crane Clan • Imperial • Courtier • Samurai • Duelist • Magistrate • Overconfident • Scout • Experienced • Unique • Imperial Explorer
During a duel involving Kazuo, the other player must focus from his hand at his first opportunity (if able).
After your End Phase begins, if Kazuo won a duel, or you have gained 4 or more Honor, this turn: Look at the top three cards of a Fate deck. Put them back in any order.
card.flavor: "I am an explorer, not a common thief."

card.name: Mirumoto Kojinrue - exp
card.text:
Dragon Clan • Imperial • Samurai • Elite • Kensai • Scout • Experienced • Unique • Imperial Explorer
Kojinrue may assign even if bowed.
You may choose Kojinrue to perform actions requiring an unbowed performer even if he is bowed.
card.flavor: "I wonder if these ruins could be of use to us..."

card.name: Mirumoto Kyoshiro
card.text:
Dragon Clan • Courtier • Duelist • Magistrate
Open: Target another player's Doji Iza: Kyoshiro duels her. Destroy the duel's loser.
card.flavor: "I will not rest until I see you breathe your last, felled by my blade"

card.name: Mirumoto Yonekura
card.text:
Dragon Clan • Samurai • Elite • Kensai
(Elite cards contribute Force even if bowed.)
card.flavor: "Consider this a lesson in humility."

card.name: Mirumoto Yozo - exp2
card.text:
Dragon Clan • Samurai • Duelist • Sensei • Experienced 2 • Unique • Favored of the Fire Dragon
After Yozo enters play or overlays: Discard all your other Sensei Personalities.
After your Iaijutsu action resolves: Give any Personality who performed it +2F.
card.flavor: He has set aside his hatred and preaches serenity to his students.

card.name: Tamori Tsuchiya
card.text:
Dragon Clan • Earth • Shugenja • Alchemist
Battle: If Tsuchiya is defending, destroy one of his Spells: Give him Stalwart and a Force bonus equal to his current Force. (Stalwart cards negate their first bowing each turn by other players' cards).
card.flavor: He is slow to anger, yet strikes with terrible precision when roused.

card.name: Togashi Mihato
card.text:
Dragon Clan • Water • Monk • Tattooed
Battle: Target an enemy Personality: Move him home.
card.flavor: "The Imperial Legions are marching against the Second City? What are they prepared to do when they arrive?"

card.name: Akodo Chiyo
card.text:
Lion Clan • Samurai • Tactician
Crab Clan players may ignore Chiyo's Honor Requirement.
Battle: Melee 4 Attack.
card.flavor: "If it is the Spider who have attacked us, perhaps we should turn to those versed in fighting such abominations."

card.name: Ikoma Shizuka
card.text:
Lion Clan • Samurai • Scout • Cavalry
Limited: Bow Shizuka: Search your Dynasty or Fate deck. If you find a Region, attach it to one of your provinces, paying all costs. If you find a Terrain, put it in your hand and discard a card.
card.flavor: "He is silent, observant, and possessed of a perfect memory. He has made oour search for the Yodotai a great deal easier." - Ikoma Shika

card.name: Ikoma Satoru - exp
card.text:
Lion Clan • Samurai • Artisan • Tactician • Experienced • Unique • Turquoise Champion
Limited: Show a card in your hand and choose another player: You offer it as a gift. He may put it in his hand; if he did, draw two cards. Otherwise, discard it, and Melee Attack with strength equal to its Focus Value targeting a Follower or Personality without Followers in his home.
card.flavor: "They should have remained uninvolved. A pity."

card.name: Kitsu Miwa
card.text:
Lion Clan • Water • Shugenja • Apprentice • Messenger
Limited: If Miwa is face-up in your province, discard her and pay 2 Gold: Search your Dynasty deck for a non-Unique Lion Clan Shugenja. Refill this province with him, face-up.
card.flavor: "A report from the Second City, my lady. The Akodo are not certain what the Spider have used against us, and hope you can unravel this mystery."

card.name: Matsu Sango
card.text:
Lion Clan • Samurai
Will not attach Items.
During battle resolutions, if Sango is attacking, he contributes his Force twice.
card.flavor: "Peace is a blessing to the Empire, perhaps, but a curse upon a warrior."

card.name: Matsu Yoshito
card.text:
Lion Clan • Samurai • Cavalry • Paragon
Yoshito has +1F while attacking, or +2F if the defender is Dragon Clan.
card.flavor: "It is clear that the Spider are at fault. If the Dragon wish to defend that despicable clan, then the stories of their wisdom and honor are lies."

card.name: Kitsune Yuribara
card.text:
Mantis Clan • Earth • Shugenja
Reaction: After Yuribara enters play: Create a 0F/2C/3PH Mantis Clan • Nonhuman • Butterfly • Cavalry • Spirit Personality with the traits, "Other player's Battle actions must target a Butterfly Personality at this battlefield, if legal" and "After another player's Battle action targets this card: Destroy this card."
card.flavor: "Distract him, my little ones."

card.name: Yoritomo Harumi
card.text:
Mantis Clan • Earth • Thunder • Shugenja • Naval • Loyal • Unique
Once per battle, Harumi may perform the Equip Battle action even if bowed and even if unopposed.
Battle: Target an enemy Follower or Personality without Followers: Give it -5F. Gain 2 Honor. If its Force is now 0 or you control Yoritomo Hiromi, destroy it. If it is still in play, you may take an additional Battle action.

card.name: Moshi Ira
card.text:
Mantis Clan • Thunder • Shugenja • Naval
Reaction: After an action targets a card in this unit: Give the action's performer (if any) -3F after the action resolves.
card.flavor: "I understand she guided her ship through the heart of a typhoon with hardly a scratch. What a pity I cannot have her on my own vessel." - Yoritomo Kaishou

card.name: Yoritomo Hofu
card.text: Mantis Clan • Samurai • Conqueror • Magistrate • Naval • Captain of The Fourth Storm
card.flavor: "We have faced the unnatural terrors of these waters for twenty years and survived. Do the Crane really think they can trouble us where the Great Death has failed?"

card.name: Yoritomo Naoto - exp
card.text:
Mantis Clan • Imperial • Samurai • Naval • Scout • Stalwart • Experienced • Unique • Imperial Explorer
Battle: Target an enemy Personality: Actions he or his Followers perform must target Naoto, if legal. You may take an additional Battle action.
card.flavor: "The Crane think to confront us? They will find only a watery grave."

card.name: Yoritomo Tansen
card.text:
Mantis Clan • Samurai • Naval • Scout
Battle: Ranged 3 Attack or give the current battlefield's province -3 strength.
card.flavor: "My lord, this chui Daidoji Senshi seems unsettlingly well prepared for conflict with our clan, as though he has been expecting it... or planning to start it."

card.name: Asako Izuna - exp
card.text:
Phoenix Clan • Air • Courtier • Shugenja • Inquisitor • Magistrate • Villain • Experienced • Unique • Amethyst Champion
Political Limited: Take the Imperial Favor.
Battle/Limited: Target another player's card in a unit: Bow the target. If it is Kolat, Ninja, or Shadowlands, choose a player who gains or loses 2 Honor.
card.flavor: "Tell me more. Tell me all of it."

card.name: Asako Kyuudo
card.text:
Phoenix Clan • Earth • Shugenja • Inquisitor • Magistrate
Kyuudo has +3F and Elite while defending (Elite cards contribute Force even if bowed).
card.flavor: "Yuzuki-dono, I apologize for my impertinence, but I believe you are wrong. If you had seen what I have, you would agree that not all gaijin knowledge is beneficial to the Empire."

card.name: Asako Suzukaze
card.text:
Phoenix Clan • Air • Monk • Henshin
Limited: Target a Holding: It produces 1 additional Gold when it bows to produce Gold (this turn).
card.flavor: "My niece is a fine example of our order's greatest gifts, though when her anger is roused she can sometimes be a trifle... hasty." - Asako Souta, Phoenix Clan Ambassador

card.name: Isawa Hibana
card.text:
Phoenix Clan • Fire • Shugenja
Battle/Open: Give Hibana -3F and target your Personality without the Water keyword: Give him +3F.
card.flavor: "Miko's daughter has inherited all her mother's gifts with the fire kami, but puts them to intriguingly constructive uses." - Isawa Ochiai

card.name: Shiba Tetsaka
card.text:
Phoenix Clan • Samurai • Duelist • Yojimbo
Open: Bow your performing Shugenja: Give Tetsaka Cavalry or Naval.
card.flavor: "I do not wish to waste away my days guarding some scholar or healer. Where would be the glory in that?"

card.name: Isawa Mizuhama
card.text: Phoenix Clan • Water • Shugenja
card.flavor: "Even in this foreign land, the water kami still answer in the ways of their element... gentle as a spring rain, or ferocious as a tidal wave."

card.name: Bayushi Hamada
card.text:
Scorpion Clan • Samurai • Paragon • Yojimbo • Loyal
Crab Clan players may control Hamada.
Hamada has +1F for each of your Personalities who is Crab Clan or a Courtier.
card.flavor: "My friend Yasuki, you have my blade at your disposal. Whatever the Crab require, the Scorpion are more than happy to assist you."

card.name: Bayushi Kazutoshi - exp2
card.text:
Scorpion Clan • Courtier • Samurai • Sensei • Experienced 2 • Loyal • Unique
After Kazutoshi enters play or overlays: Discard all your other Sensei Personalities.
Before the first time each turn another player's card effect destroys one of your Loyal Personalities: Negate the destruction. Move him home. Bow him. Dishonor him.
card.flavor: "Greetings, dragon. I would have words."

card.name: Bayushi Wakui
card.text:
Scorpion Clan • Samurai • Magistrate • Yojimbo
Reaction: When another player would target a Magistrate at Wakui's battlefield with an action: The action targets Wakui instead, if legal.
card.flavor: "Your steel is weak and unequal to the task. Just like the man who wields it."

card.name: Shosuro Makiko - exp
card.text:
Scorpion Clan • Courtier • Seductress • Experienced • Loyal • Unique
Political Open: Bow Makiko: Take the Imperial Favor.
Political Reaction: Before an action resolves, bow Makiko: Reduce all Honor gains from it by 2.
card.flavor: "It is a simple matter to infulence minds. Magic? Why would I need such a thing?"

card.name: Shosuro Tanihara
card.text:
Scorpion Clan • Ninja
While Tanihara is attacking at a battlefield, its province has a maximum strength equal to its base strength.
card.flavor: "I have found the beast's lair, Kazutoshi-sensei. I can lead you to it. We will know the truth at last."

card.name: Soshi Shinoko
card.text:
Scorpion Clan • Courtier • Cavalry
Open: Target a Personality: Give him Brash (the Defender may draw a card after a Brash card is assigned to attack).
card.flavor: "I cannot speak to the kami, but I have little time to lament it. I have found other ways to serve, and my lord has never found fault with my wervice."

card.name: Daigotsu Bofana - exp
card.text:
Spider Clan • Imperial • Shadowlands • Samurai • Paragon • Scout • Experienced • Loyal • Unique • Dark Scion of Fire • Imperial Explorer
After Bofana enters play: Lose 2 Honor and all other players must discard a card, or two cards if they are Crab Clan.
Battle: Target a Dark Virtue in your discard pile: Take an additional action to play it for one of its Battle actions. After it resolves, remove it from the game.

card.name: Daigotsu Arare
card.text: Spider Clan • Shadowlands • Samurai
card.flavor: "The Crab cast aside their duties in order to attack us, and without provocation. So be it then! I am ready for them!"

card.name: Fubuko
card.text:
Spider Clan • Monk • Kensai • Order of the Spider
Enters play paying 1 less Gold if you are a Dragon Clan player.
Battle: Take an additional action to play a Kiho Strategy in your discard pile, which Fubuko must perform, for one of its Battle actions. After it resolves, remove the Strategy from the game.
card.flavor: "I can see truth in the Dragon's riddles."

card.name: Ninube Tsukau
card.text:
Spider Clan • Shadowlands • Ninja • Shugenja
After Tsukau enters play: Lose 3 Honor.
Open: Once per game, target a non-Unique Human Personality: Tsukau permanently copies his Force, one of his keywords, and one of his base abilities which does not itself copy abilities.

card.name: Daigotsu Shiraume
card.text:
Spider Clan • Shadowlands • Samurai • Conqueror • Paragon • Dark Conquest
After Shiraume enters play: Lose 1 Honor.
card.flavor: "Whatever needs to be done to accumulate power should be done without hesitation. That is the way of the world. What use is a person who balks at such things?"

card.name: Daigotsu Hashibei
card.text:
Spider Clan • Samurai • Commander • Recruitment Officer
Fear Open: Bow Hashibei and target your Personality: Create a 1F Follower and attach it to him.
card.flavor: The Spider were still respected as benevolent guardians by the heimen. They manipulated their simple fears and grew more popular than ever.

card.name: Chuda Kaito
card.text:
Shadowlands • Shugenja
After Kaito enters play: Lose 2 Honor.
Kaito has +3GC while the effects of a Spell action he performed are resolving.
card.flavor: "Well," he said philosophically, "there is always a use for a dead oni."

card.name: Chun
card.text:
Mercenary • Naval • Captain of The Tachikaze
Human Personalities in Chun's army have Naval.
card.flavor: "There is no need to learn to swim before venturing to sea. That is the job of the ship."

card.name: Mumoku no Oni
card.text:
Shadowlands • Nonhuman • Oni • Elite
(Elite cards contribute Force even if bowed.)
After Mumoku enters play: Lose 4 Honor.
While Mumoko is attacking at a battlefield, its province has a maximum strength equal to its base strength.
card.flavor: "The beast crushes walls like flowers. It bears a resemblance to the dragons, and may be as poswerful." - Kuni Renyu

card.name: Riku
card.text:
Ronin • Samurai • Commander • Duelist • Yojimbo • Unique
Reaction: When another player's action would target Tamahime: It targets Riku instead, if legal.
Iaijutsu Battle: Target an enemy Personality: Riku duels him. Destroy the duel's loser.
card.flavor: "My sword is as ten swords where Tamahime-sama's honor is concerned."

card.name: Seppun Ryota
card.text:
Imperial • Samurai • Duelist • Paragon • Yojimbo
Reaction: Before an action resolves that targeted your Personality at Ryota's location: He enters any duel created by its effects instead of the target.
card.flavor: "Please," he said, interposing himself between the two, "allow me to take care of this trifling matter."

card.name: Utaku Suying
card.text:
Unicorn Clan • Samurai • Battle Maiden • Cavalry • Paragon
After a battle resolution in which Suying's army destroyed a defending army or province: Gain 2 Honor.
card.flavor: "I have concerns for my kinsmen in the Colonies, but I will obey the edicts of my lady Ji-Yun. There can be no divided loyalties when commanded by the Emerald Champion."

card.name: Iuchi Shaocheng
card.text:
Unicorn Clan • Water • Shugenja • Cavalry • Death Priest
After Shaocheng enters play: Turn a card in a province face-up. If it is a non-Unique Personality, discard him and he becomes Honorably Dead.
card.flavor: "The time may come when the Lords of Death pass judgment upon the whole of the Colonies. It will be unfortunate, but I will not hesitate."

card.name: Moto Ogaru
card.text:
Unicorn Clan • Samurai • Cavalry • Commander
Ogaru has +1F while the enemy leader controls an Imperial card or the Imperial Favor.
card.flavor: "He is an enormous, brutish-looking man, but with an easy laugh and a gentle nature. He must be pure of soul as well. Why else would pandas bear him such affinity?" - Utaku Ji-Yun

card.name: Shinjo Tselu
card.text:
Unicorn Clan • Imperial • Samurai • Cavalry • Commander • Magistrate • Unique • Ivory Champion
Cavalry Followers attach to your Personalities paying 2 less Gold.
After another player's action targets Tselu: That player discards a card.
card.flavor: "I do not know what my destiny is, but I know I will meet it with steel in my hand and no regrets in my heart."

card.name: Shinjo Sihung
card.text:
Unicorn Clan • Samurai • Tactician
Reaction: After your Tactical action resolves: Give a Personality who performed it +2F.
card.flavor: "The Lion were encroaching into our territory, despite our warnings. And they made no effort to warn us of the approaching legion! It is clear that they have no respect for us."

card.name: Utaku Ji-Yun - exp
card.text:
Unicorn Clan • Imperial • Samurai • Battle Maiden • Cavalry • Magistrate • Paragon • Experienced • Unique • Emerald Champion
Your dishonorable Paragons do not have a maximum Personal Honor of 0 from the rulebook.
Reaction: After engaging at Ji-Yun's battlefield, target a Personality opposing her: He may not use his abilities.
card.flavor: "Justice at any cost, save honor."

card.name: Kokure's Lands
card.text:
Unique
This province does not hold Dynasty cards.
Limited: Bow this card: Draw a card.
card.flavor: "The lands approaching the Second City have been fortified by the local lord, Mirumoto Kokure. It seems he too has embraced the corrupting influences of this foreign land."

card.name: Brothers of the Great Lake
card.text:
This card has +1F for each other Brothers of the Great Lake in this army.
Battle: Target an enemy card: Bow it.
card.flavor: "Strength in numbers," the oldest said, "or numbers in strength?" Privately, the youngest brother thought there was little difference.

card.name: Destrier
card.text:
Cavalry
Melee and Ranged Attacks targeting this card have -3 strength.
card.flavor: "Not bad riding." - Utaku Ji-Yun

card.name: Disciples of Master Coin
card.text:
Kolat
Open: If this card did not enter play this turn, bow it and target a Holding with equal or lower gold cost: Straighten it.
card.flavor: "Money obeys its own laws." - Master Coin

card.name: Cavalry Flankers
card.text:
Cavalry
Battle: If you are the Attacker, bow this card: Melee 2 Attack.
card.flavor: "Fast horses have to be good for something," the gunso said with a savage grin.

card.name: Goju Kaxt
card.text:
Ninja
Other Ninja in this army have +1F.
After an action resolves during which this card was destroyed: Create a 4F/3C/0PH Ninja Personality with your Clan alignment at any location.
card.flavor: His gaijin ancestry only makes him more deadly.

card.name: Oriole Imperial Vanguard
card.text:
Imperial
This Personality has +1PH.
Before the first Political action that targeted this Personality this phase resolves: Negate its effects.
card.flavor: "It may not be Rokugan," the guardsman said, "but service is service everywhere."

card.name: Sycophants
card.text: Political Limited: Bow this card: Straighten this Personality. You may use his Political abilities that may only be used once per turn a second time (this turn).
card.flavor: "Yes, of course," the courtier said, just to get rid of him, then realized what she had agreed to.

card.name: Uji's Saboteurs
card.text:
Scout
This Personality has Naval while he is Crane Clan.
Battle: Target an enemy attachment: Destroy it.
card.flavor: "We remember Daidoji-sama's methods," the man whispered as he let loose the last casket.

card.name: Kage's Teachings
card.text:
Unique
This Personality has Kolat.
Open: If it is not your turn, bow this card and choose a player: He chooses and bows one of his unbowed Personalities.
card.flavor: "Such amazing thoughts! They will serve me well in the chaos now spreading." - Doji Muroken

card.name: Sturdy Armor
card.text:
Armor
Battle: Three times per turn: Give this Personality +1F.
